alert.note: Alert for Lower Washington County; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 13 at 3:07PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Lower Washington County and Zion National Park. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, slick rock areas, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The remnants of Tropical Storm Kay will move across Utah today, bringing deep tropical moisture and ample instability that will aid in the development of showers and thunderstorms. Any storms that develop have the potential to produce very heavy rainfall capable of producing flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Lower Washington County; Zion National Park
